Real Execution: Context Loss Discovery & Fix

Actual production execution showing how our "Rules as Guidance" approach identified and solved a critical context loss problem that was causing incorrect subtask generation.

Problem Discovery Phase

User Request vs. Actual Implementation

❌ What User Asked For:
Task: "Update memory bank files and README
with current business value"

Expected Files to Update:
• memory-bank/ProjectOverview.md
• memory-bank/TechnicalArchitecture.md
• memory-bank/DeveloperGuide.md
• README.md
❌ What Was Actually Created:
Created Validation Scripts Instead:
• validation-script.js
• content-analysis-script.js
• business-value-validation-script.js
• quality-gates-definition.js

ZERO actual documentation files updated!
Complete disconnect between user intent and implementation

Root Cause Analysis

1

Architect Step 1

Create Implementation Plan

✅ CORRECT PLAN CREATED:
• Update 4 documentation files
• Remove legacy references
• Update business value content
• Context preserved ✓
2

Architect Step 2

Create Subtasks (BROKEN)

❌ CONTEXT LOST:
• Forgot original task intent
• Created validation subtasks
• Meta-analysis instead of work
• Context broken ✗

Result

Wrong Implementation

COMPLETE DISCONNECT:
• Plan = Update files ✓
• Subtasks = Create scripts ✗
• User frustrated ✗
• Wasted execution time ✗

Key Insight

The problem wasn't the architect's intelligence - it was the separation of planning and subtask creation into different steps, causing critical context loss that led to misaligned implementations.
